Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Steps 1 Parse the logs into lists of events 2 For each event in Log A try to find a matching event in Log B and vice versa based on order_id must match The event types names should be semantically similar we may need a mapping The timestamps should be within a tolerance eg 2 seconds 3 We note that Log B has richer attributes So when merging we want to keep all attributes from both logs 4 If we merge we create a single event with A primary timestamp we can choose the one from Log A as the primary

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 6 We need to decide on a mapping for event types Lets list the events Log A Order Received Order Validated Payment Processed Item Shipped Item Delivered Log B OrderReceived OrderValidation PaymentCheck Quality Check Shipping We can map Order Received Log A and OrderReceived Log B same event Order Validated and OrderValidation same Payment Processed and PaymentCheck same Item Shipped and Shipping same Then Quality Check in Log B has no counterpart in Log A and Item Delivered in Log A has no counterpart in Log B

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: 11 We want the final log in chronological order We can use the timestamp from Log A for merged events or from Log B if only in Log B 12 However note that the timestamps in Log A and Log B are not exactly the same We are told Log A is the primary timeline timestamps may reflect the time events are received not when they started Lets decide Well use the timestamp from Log A for events that are in Log A or merged with Log B for ordering and for events only in Log B use Log B timestamp But note that the timestamps are very close so the order should be consistent

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: b For each event in Log A try to find a matching event in Log B by order_id must match The event name in Log B must map to the event type in Log A using a mapping The absolute difference in timestamps is <= 2 seconds c If found merge the two events d After processing all events in Log A collect the remaining events in Log B that were not matched e Sort the merged events and the unmatched events by timestamp 22 Well mark events as matched so we dont reuse them
